website_summaries.verdict: If you need a 3D printer that will easily handle making tall and wide items with extra-touch PLA plastic, this extra-large model is your best bet.
pros: Huge print space of 2,549 square inches
Designed for printing massive prototype objects
cons: This 3D printer is awfully pricy model

customer_reviews.title: bad version of product
customer_reviews.text: defective, not by an authorized seller, was pre-owned despite full new pricing.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Hurley

customer_reviews.title: Don’t even consider it
customer_reviews.text: Always misprinted, had stringy residue and issues. Thought this would be a good product because it is a big brand but trust the other reviews for this it isn’t worth it and it doesn’t print accurate at all. Messed up my 1 day print several times and is almost so bad it’s unusable.
customer_reviews.author: oprib

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: The institution I work for had the misfortune of being suckered into shelling out $6000 for this device, and I gotta tell you I'm SO GLAD I didn't waste MY MONEY on it. Absolutely every print is garbage. I spin knobs, tweak settings, read forums, read manuals, switch filiment, you name it. I've tried every suggestion in the book and it doesn't make a lick of difference. The institution replaced the extruder with the smart extruder +, doesn't matter. The prints are awful. They're not even just stringy, I could cut that off, they are an intangible, amorphous cloud of spaghetti mess at any setting. JUNK! DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.author: Thorin Teague

customer_reviews.title: Really bad 3-d printer for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a really bad printer for the price. Look at all the negative reviews and those will be the most accurate. Common issues I had with the other poor reviewers were: 1. Poor print quality. 2. Limited software settings 3. Filaments tangled a few times causing print errors. 4. Poor customer support 5. Bad return policy, they will charge you a restocking fee! Avoid at all cost!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BAD PRODCUT AND CUSTOMER SUPPORT
customer_reviews.text: We purchased a Z18 and it worked well for a short period. A few months before the warrantee expired it started to print terribly and make noises. Makerbot sent replacement parts that did not fix it so they decided to replace the machine. Here we are going on over 2-3 months without being able to print and the new machine right out of the box printed terribly, even when printing their internal test prints with their filament. I would NOT PURCHASE another one of their printers.
customer_reviews.author: TSCOTT

customer_reviews.title: Problem after problem after problem
customer_reviews.text: Very unhappy with this product and I don't recommend it to anyone. Not worth the price for all the issues I have to deal with. In the last 3 years, I had 3 replacement printers because each failed in a different way. Extruder fails often. The filament feeding mechanism into the extruder isn't the best so it tugs on the extruder often. I often get messy prints that don't seem to get better even when I change the settings. Would give 0 stars if possible, but giving one for the support team..They have been responsive and troubleshooting but even they cannot fix or understand some of the issues I have.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This printer is terrible. We have had one in our school for several years and we spend more time fixing/troubleshooting then we do printing. More filament is wasted on failed prints then used on successful prints, which are rare. I am shocked this large paperweight is still being sold for $6000. Don’t waste your money on this useless machine.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Way Over Priced Junk!
customer_reviews.text: Could Not Send it Back fast enough. Bought A Prusa MK3S
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy a CR10 and Save $6,000
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy! Moduler extruders are too expensive, have to use MakerBot slicer which also sucks. The chamber won't get or stay at a good temp. Constant warping. The ONLY good thing about this is it's size. Buy a CR10 to get the size and save $6,000. This printer sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Levon Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Z18 Workhorse
customer_reviews.text: I have put this printer through a work out. It runs for weeks and months at a time. Since firmware updates about a year ago the unit has been working great. The build volume and features cannot be beat for the price. I have tried many machines and just love the Z18 and the support from MakerBot. I regularly get full build prints without issues. The new smart extruder plus also added some improved quality and reliability to the printing process. This unit is very well built I have moved it many times and taken to different sites with no reset up needed. I plan to add another one to my lab this year. Highly recommend the Z18.
customer_reviews.author: Fab Guy

customer_reviews.title: MakerBot Z18
customer_reviews.text: Initially, we had some difficulty with the Z18. But MakerBot was very helpful in helping us troubleshoot problems and even sent us their new Smart Extruder +. Since then, my students have had nothing but good results printing their designs. MakerBot's customer support team is awesome and continues to assist us whenever we have questions and/or questionable results.
customer_reviews.author: D. CONNER

customer_reviews.title: Absolut trash 0 star
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work it started spitting out the filamentfor no reason in midair it wasn't accurate and it didn't print good-quality I had done all the best setting it's just trash but I did some research and I found a 3-D printer called Lolz bot and it's unbelievable
customer_reviews.author: Justin

product_meta.title: MakerBot Replicator Z18 3D Printer, Firmware Version 1.7+
feature_bullets: Seamlessly integrated with the growing MakerBot 3D Ecosystem of hardware, software, materials, accessories, and solutions
Powered by the user-friendly, app- and cloud-enabled MakerBot OS that’s regularly enhanced with software updates
USB, Ethernet, or Wi-Fi connectivity creates a seamless production workflow
Compatible with the new MakerBot Smart Extruder+.Layer Resolution:100 microns
